Module ZiqiYang
Package org.ziqi.gameEngine.manager

Class DataManager

java.lang.Object
org.ziqi.gameEngine.manager.GameManager
org.ziqi.gameEngine.manager.DataManager
public class DataManager
extends GameManager
DataManager class as game manager to take charge of recording high scores(timing and move count) of players for each levels. Records will be handled by data manager to read from outside file, keep updating records and write into file.
Author:
Ziqi Yang
See Also:
GameManager

  • Field Details

    • MAX_TIMEOUT

      private static final int MAX_TIMEOUT
      Constant integer restricts the max timing value.
      When time out, the time integer wont be updated any more.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • m_MoveCount

      private int m_MoveCount
      Integer specifying the the valid move count of player in current level.

    • m_secondTimer

      private int m_secondTimer
      Unformatted integer specifying the second time elapsed from last reset/start.
      See Also:
      updateTimeString(), Utils.getTimeString(long)

    • m_TimeString

      private final javafx.beans.property.SimpleStringProperty m_TimeString
      Formatted SimpleStringProperty specifying the time elapsed from last reset/start.
      See Also:
      updateTimeString(), Utils.getTimeString(long)

    • m_ScoreRecords

      private javafx.collections.ObservableList<ScoreRecord> m_ScoreRecords
      ObservableList of type ScoreRecord containing all records read from data file.

  • Constructor Details

    • DataManager

      public DataManager()
      DataManager constructor.
      When instantiating the DataManager object, a timeline is played to keep track of time elapsed during playing the game.
      See Also:
      startTimer(), Timeline

  • Method Details

    • getM_TimeString

      public javafx.beans.property.SimpleStringProperty getM_TimeString()
      Gets the formatted SimpleStringProperty specifying the time elapsed from last reset/start.
      Returns:
      The formatted SimpleStringProperty is returned to the caller.
      See Also:
      updateTimeString(), Utils.getTimeString(long)

    • getM_secondTimer

      public int getM_secondTimer()
      Gets the unformatted integer time specifying the time elapsed from last reset/start.
      Returns:
      The formatted SimpleStringProperty is returned to the caller.
      See Also:
      updateTimeString(), Utils.getTimeString(long)

    • getM_MoveCount

      public int getM_MoveCount()
      Gets the integer specifying the the valid move count of player in current level.
      Returns:
      The integer specifying the the valid move count of player in current level is returned to the caller.

    • incrementMoveCount

      public void incrementMoveCount​(int increment)
      Increments the move count by given value.
      When player is grounded, move count increment by 1 for every valid move;
      When player is flying, move count increment by 2 for every valid move.
      Parameters:
      increment - Integer specifying the value to increment on move count.
      See Also:
      Player

    • resetMoveCount

      public void resetMoveCount()
      Resets the move count integer to zero.
      This method is called when user intends to restart the level or a new level begins.

    • resetTime

      public void resetTime()
      Resets the second time integer to zero.
      This method is called when user intends to restart the level or a new level begins.

    • startTimer

      public void startTimer()
      Starts to play a new timeline as timer to keep track of time elapsed.
      This method is called when the DataManager is instantiated.
      See Also:
      Timeline, updateTimeString(), m_secondTimer

    • readScoreRecords

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<ScoreRecord> readScoreRecords()
      Reads all permanent high-score records from record file into a list of records.
      This method is called when the score board screen or pop up screen is displayed.
      Returns:
      An ObservableList of type ScoreBoard containing all permanent high-score records is returned to caller.
      See Also:
      ScoreRecord, ScoreBoardScreenController

    • getTopRecord

      public ScoreRecord getTopRecord()
      Finds and gets the high score record of current level from m_ScoreRecords observableList.
      If no record exists for this level, then create an empty record and add it to the m_ScoreRecords observableList.
      The new create empty record has value -1 as time and move count and "anonymous" as player name.
      Returns:
      A ScoreRecord object either found from high score records or new-created is return to caller.
      See Also:
      ScoreRecord, m_ScoreRecords

    • updateRecord

      public void updateRecord​(int fastestTime, int minimumMove, java.lang.String playerName, ScoreRecord scoreRecord)
      Compares and updates the fields of given ScoreRecord object by given parameters.
      After updating the ScoreRecord object, this method calls writeAllScoreRecords() to write new records into data file.
      Parameters:
      fastestTime - Integer specifying current fastest time record of current level. If this value is equal to value of given scoreRecord, then no need to update this record.
      minimumMove - Integer specifying current minimum move record of current level. If this value is equal to value of given scoreRecord, then no need to update this record.
      playerName - String value specifying player's name got from input.
      scoreRecord - ScoreRecord object to be updated by above parameters.
      See Also:
      writeAllScoreRecords(), ScoreRecord, m_ScoreRecords

    • writeAllScoreRecords

      private void writeAllScoreRecords()
      Writes all score records contained in ObservableList m_ScoreRecords into data file permanently.
      This method is called when any record is updated from m_ScoreRecords.
      See Also:
      ScoreRecord, m_ScoreRecords, updateRecord(int, int, String, ScoreRecord)

    • updateTimeString

      private void updateTimeString()
      Transforms the second time integer into formatted string of m_TimeString variable.
      If the time is greater than or equals to the MAX_TIMEOUT, then the time string won't be updated.
      See Also:
      m_TimeString, m_ScoreRecords, MAX_TIMEOUT, Utils.getTimeString(long)
